p: Human parechovirus type 3 was the predominant type detected between August 2017 and January/February 2018, which coincided with a peak number of cases of HPeV in infants in south eastern Australia (Fig.Â 1). HPeV1 was detected between March and May 2017 and again from late January to May 2018, periods prior to, and following the HPeV3 epidemic.
